questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A car accelerates uniformly from rest to 20 m/s in 5 seconds. What is the distance covered by the car during this time?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the equation v = u + at, we find acceleration a = (20-0)/5 = 4 m/s². Then, using s = ut + (1/2)at², s = 0*5 + (1/2)*4*(5)² = 2*25 = 50 m.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A block of mass 5 kg is resting on a horizontal surface. A force of 20 N is applied horizontally. If the coefficient of kinetic friction is 0.2, what is the acceleration of the block? (Take g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Friction force f_k = μ_k * N = μ_k * mg = 0.2 * 5 kg * 10 m/s² = 10 N. Net force = Applied force - Friction force = 20 N - 10 N = 10 N. Acceleration a = Net force / mass = 10 N / 5 kg = 2 m/s².
questions.svg_visual: <svg width="200" height="100"><rect x="50" y="50" width="100" height="30" style="fill:lightblue;stroke:black;stroke-width:2"/><line x1="20" y1="65" x2="50" y2="65" style="stroke:red;stroke-width:2;marker-end:url(#arrowhead)"/><text x="25" y="60" fill="red">20 N</text><text x="80" y="70" fill="black">5 kg</text><defs><marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="7" refX="0" refY="3.5" orient="auto"><polygon points="0 0, 10 3.5, 0 7" fill="red"/></marker></defs></svg>

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A 10 kg object is lifted vertically by a constant force of 120 N for a distance of 3 meters. What is the net work done on the object? (Take g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Work done by applied force = F_applied * d = 120 N * 3 m = 360 J. Work done by gravity = -mgd = -10 kg * 10 m/s² * 3 m = -300 J. Net work done = 360 J - 300 J = 60 J. Alternatively, net force = 120 N - (10 kg * 10 m/s²) = 20 N. Net work done = 20 N * 3 m = 60 J.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A sound wave travels at 340 m/s. If its frequency is 200 Hz, what is its wavelength?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the wave equation v = fλ, where v is speed, f is frequency, and λ is wavelength. So, λ = v/f = 340 m/s / 200 Hz = 1.7 m.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a scalar quantity?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Scalar quantities have magnitude only, while vector quantities have both magnitude and direction. Velocity, acceleration, and force are vectors, whereas mass is a scalar.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A converging lens has a focal length of 10 cm. An object is placed 15 cm from the lens. What is the image distance?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the lens formula 1/f = 1/v + 1/u. Given f = 10 cm (converging lens), u = -15 cm (object distance is negative by convention). So, 1/10 = 1/v + 1/(-15) => 1/v = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6. Therefore, v = 6 cm. Wait, 1/v = 1/10 - 1/(-15) = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6.  Oh, 1/v = 1/f - 1/u.  1/v = 1/10 - 1/(-15) = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6. The image distance is 30 cm. (Positive v indicates a real image on the opposite side of the lens).

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the phenomenon responsible for the sparkling of diamonds?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Diamonds sparkle due to their high refractive index and critical angle, which causes light to undergo multiple total internal reflections before exiting, scattering light in various directions.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If a current of 2 A flows through a resistor of 10 Ω, what is the voltage drop across the resistor?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using Ohm's Law, V = IR, where V is voltage, I is current, and R is resistance. So, V = 2 A * 10 Ω = 20 V.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which principle states that the buoyant force on a submerged object is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the object?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Archimedes' Principle explains buoyancy, stating that the upward buoyant force exerted on a body immersed in a fluid is equal to the weight of the fluid that the body displaces.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two point charges, +q and -q, are placed at a distance 'r' from each other. What is the magnitude of the electrostatic force between them?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Coulomb's Law states that the electrostatic force between two point charges is directly proportional to the product of the magnitudes of the charges and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them. F = k|q1q2|/r² = kq²/r².

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What type of mirror is used by dentists to see a magnified image of teeth?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A concave mirror produces a magnified, erect, and virtual image when an object is placed between its pole and focal point, making it suitable for dentists.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The half-life of a radioactive isotope is 2 hours. If you start with 100 grams, how much will remain after 6 hours?
questions.explanation_or_solution: After 2 hours (1 half-life), 50 g remains. After 4 hours (2 half-lives), 25 g remains. After 6 hours (3 half-lives), 12.5 g remains. (100 * (1/2)³) = 100 * (1/8) = 12.5 g.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which of the following describes the relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature of an ideal gas?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The Ideal Gas Law (PV=nRT) relates the pressure, volume, temperature, and number of moles of an ideal gas.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A pendulum completes 10 oscillations in 20 seconds. What is its frequency?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Frequency is the number of oscillations per unit time. So, frequency f = 10 oscillations / 20 seconds = 0.5 Hz.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The phenomenon of electromagnetic induction is used in which of the following devices?
questions.explanation_or_solution: An electric generator works on the principle of electromagnetic induction, where a changing magnetic flux through a coil induces an electromotive force (voltage).

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What happens to the kinetic energy of a falling object when air resistance is negligible?
questions.explanation_or_solution: As an object falls, its speed increases due to gravity. Since kinetic energy is proportional to the square of speed (KE = 1/2 mv²), its kinetic energy increases.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If the wavelength of light is 600 nm, what is its frequency? (Speed of light c = 3 x 10⁸ m/s)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using c = fλ, where c is the speed of light, f is frequency, and λ is wavelength. Convert wavelength to meters: 600 nm = 600 x 10⁻⁹ m = 6 x 10⁻⁷ m. So, f = c/λ = (3 x 10⁸ m/s) / (6 x 10⁻⁷ m) = 0.5 x 10¹⁵ Hz = 5 x 10¹⁴ Hz.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which of Newton's laws of motion describes inertia?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Newton's First Law of Motion, also known as the Law of Inertia, states that an object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The minimum energy required to eject an electron from the surface of a metal is called the:
questions.explanation_or_solution: The work function (Φ) is the minimum energy (usually measured in electronvolts) needed to remove an electron from the surface of a solid.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the unit of electric power?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The unit of electric power is the Watt (W), defined as one joule per second. Volt is the unit of voltage, Ampere for current, and Ohm for resistance.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A mass-spring system oscillates with a period T. If the mass is doubled, what happens to the period? (Assume ideal conditions)
questions.explanation_or_solution: The period of a mass-spring system is given by T = 2π√(m/k). If mass 'm' is doubled to '2m', the new period T' = 2π√(2m/k) = √2 * (2π√(m/k)) = √2 * T. So, the period increases by a factor of √2.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which type of electromagnetic wave has the longest wavelength?
questions.explanation_or_solution: In the electromagnetic spectrum, radio waves have the longest wavelengths and lowest frequencies, while gamma rays have the shortest wavelengths and highest frequencies.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the force required to accelerate a 500 kg car at 2 m/s²?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using Newton's Second Law, F = ma, where F is force, m is mass, and a is acceleration. So, F = 500 kg * 2 m/s² = 1000 N.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: According to the Law of Conservation of Energy, energy can be:
options: Transformed but not created or destroyed
questions.explanation_or_solution: The Law of Conservation of Energy states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, but it can be transformed from one form to another.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the name of the effect where light bends as it passes from one medium to another?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Refraction is the bending of light (or other waves) as it passes from one transparent medium into another, due to a change in its speed.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: How many grams of CO₂ are produced when 24 g of carbon is completely burned in oxygen? (Atomic mass: C=12, O=16)
questions.explanation_or_solution: The reaction is C + O₂ → CO₂. Molar mass of C = 12 g/mol, Molar mass of CO₂ = 12 + 2*16 = 44 g/mol. From the balanced equation, 1 mole of C (12 g) produces 1 mole of CO₂ (44 g). So, 24 g of C (2 moles) will produce 2 * 44 g = 88 g of CO₂.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is the strongest acid among the hydrohalic acids?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Acidity increases down the group for hydrohalic acids because the bond strength decreases with increasing atomic size of the halogen, making it easier to release H⁺ ions. Therefore, HI is the strongest acid among the given options.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the pH of a neutral solution at 25°C?
questions.explanation_or_solution: At 25°C, the concentration of H⁺ ions and OH⁻ ions in pure water are both 1 x 10⁻⁷ M, making the pH = -log[H⁺] = -log(1 x 10⁻⁷) = 7, which is neutral.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which type of bonding involves the sharing of electrons between atoms?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Covalent bonding is characterized by the sharing of one or more pairs of electrons between atoms to achieve a stable electron configuration.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the oxidation state of sulfur in H₂SO₄?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Hydrogen (H) has an oxidation state of +1, and Oxygen (O) has -2. For H₂SO₄: 2*(+1) + S + 4*(-2) = 0 => 2 + S - 8 = 0 => S - 6 = 0 => S = +6.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which element is a noble gas?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Noble gases are elements in Group 18 of the periodic table, including Helium, Neon, Argon, Krypton, Xenon, and Radon, known for their low reactivity.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the general formula for an alkane?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Alkanes are saturated hydrocarbons with only single bonds between carbon atoms. Their general formula is CnH2n+2, where n is the number of carbon atoms.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of an endothermic reaction?
questions.explanation_or_solution: An endothermic reaction absorbs heat from its surroundings. Melting of ice requires heat energy to break intermolecular bonds, thus it is an endothermic process.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the main component of natural gas?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Natural gas is primarily composed of methane (CH₄), typically 70-90%, along with smaller amounts of other hydrocarbons and non-hydrocarbon gases.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which phenomenon causes the scattering of light by colloidal particles?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The Tyndall effect is the scattering of light by particles in a colloid or in a very fine suspension. It is often used to distinguish colloids from true solutions.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: According to VSEPR theory, what is the shape of a methane (CH₄) molecule?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Methane has a central carbon atom bonded to four hydrogen atoms, with no lone pairs on the central atom. This results in a tetrahedral electron geometry and molecular geometry.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the common name for sodium bicarbonate?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO₃) is commonly known as baking soda. It is used as a leavening agent in baking.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of these is a d-block element?
questions.explanation_or_solution: d-block elements are also known as transition metals. Iron (Fe) is located in the d-block of the periodic table, specifically in Group 8, Period 4.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the maximum number of electrons that can occupy the third energy level (n=3)?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The maximum number of electrons in an energy level 'n' is given by the formula 2n². For n=3, the maximum number of electrons is 2*(3)² = 2*9 = 18.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is a strong base?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Strong bases fully dissociate in water to produce hydroxide ions (OH⁻). Sodium hydroxide (NaOH) is a classic example of a strong base. NH₃ (ammonia) is a weak base, CH₃COOH (acetic acid) is a weak acid, and H₂CO₃ (carbonic acid) is a weak acid.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The process of converting a liquid into a gas below its boiling point is called:
questions.explanation_or_solution: Evaporation is the process by which atoms or molecules in a liquid state gain sufficient energy to spontaneously transition into the gaseous state below its boiling point.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the mass of 0.5 moles of water (H₂O)? (Atomic mass: H=1, O=16)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Molar mass of H₂O = (2*1) + 16 = 18 g/mol. Mass = moles * molar mass = 0.5 mol * 18 g/mol = 9 g.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which type of reaction involves the transfer of electrons?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A redox (reduction-oxidation) reaction is a type of chemical reaction that involves a transfer of electrons between two species, leading to changes in their oxidation states.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The phenomenon by which an element can exist in two or more different forms with different physical properties but identical chemical properties is called:
questions.explanation_or_solution: Allotropy is the property of some chemical elements to exist in two or more different forms, in the same physical state, known as allotropes. Examples include carbon (diamond, graphite).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a homogeneous mixture?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A homogeneous mixture has a uniform composition and appearance throughout. Saltwater (a solution) is an example, as the salt is completely dissolved and evenly distributed in the water.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If x² - 5x + 6 = 0, what are the values of x?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The quadratic equation x² - 5x + 6 = 0 can be factored as (x - 2)(x - 3) = 0. Therefore, the values of x are 2 and 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: In a right-angled triangle, if the two shorter sides are 3 cm and 4 cm, what is the length of the hypotenuse?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the Pythagorean theorem, a² + b² = c². So, 3² + 4² = c² => 9 + 16 = c² => 25 = c² => c = 5 cm.
questions.svg_visual: <svg width="200" height="150"><polygon points="10,140 10,60 70,140" style="fill:none;stroke:black;stroke-width:2"/><text x="5" y="100" font-size="14">3 cm</text><text x="30" y="145" font-size="14">4 cm</text><text x="40" y="90" font-size="14">?</text><rect x="10" y="130" width="10" height="10" style="fill:none;stroke:black;stroke-width:1"/></svg>

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the derivative of f(x) = 3x² + 2x - 1?
questions.explanation_or_solution: To find the derivative, apply the power rule: d/dx(axⁿ) = naxⁿ⁻¹. So, d/dx(3x²) = 6x, d/dx(2x) = 2, and d/dx(-1) = 0. Thus, the derivative is 6x + 2.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Simplify the expression: 2(x + 3) - (x - 1)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Expand the terms: 2x + 6 - x + 1. Combine like terms: (2x - x) + (6 + 1) = x + 7.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If a = 3 and b = -2, what is the value of a² - b³?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Substitute the values: a² = 3² = 9. b³ = (-2)³ = -8. So, a² - b³ = 9 - (-8) = 9 + 8 = 17.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the area of a circle with a radius of 7 cm? (Use π ≈ 22/7)
questions.explanation_or_solution: The area of a circle is given by A = πr². A = (22/7) * (7 cm)² = (22/7) * 49 cm² = 22 * 7 cm² = 154 cm².

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Solve for x: 3x + 7 = 19
questions.explanation_or_solution: Subtract 7 from both sides: 3x = 19 - 7 => 3x = 12. Divide by 3: x = 12 / 3 => x = 4.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the sum of the interior angles of a quadrilateral?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The sum of the interior angles of a polygon with n sides is given by (n-2) * 180°. For a quadrilateral, n=4, so (4-2) * 180° = 2 * 180° = 360°.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Find the value of sin(30°) + cos(60°).

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If a set A = {1, 2, 3, 4} and a set B = {3, 4, 5, 6}, what is A ∪ B?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A ∪ B (union of A and B) includes all elements that are in A, or in B, or in both. So, A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the value of 5! (5 factorial)?

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: The price of an item was increased by 20% and then decreased by 20%. What is the net percentage change in the price?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Let the original price be P. Increased by 20%: P * 1.20 = 1.2P. Decreased by 20%: 1.2P * 0.80 = 0.96P. The net change is P - 0.96P = 0.04P. So, a 4% decrease.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If y = x³, what is dy/dx?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the power rule for differentiation, d/dx(xⁿ) = nxⁿ⁻¹. So, d/dx(x³) = 3x².

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the common difference of the arithmetic progression: 5, 8, 11, 14, ...?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The common difference (d) is found by subtracting any term from its succeeding term. d = 8 - 5 = 3; d = 11 - 8 = 3. So, the common difference is 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the value of log₁₀(1000)?
questions.explanation_or_solution: log₁₀(1000) asks: 10 to what power equals 1000? Since 10³ = 1000, the value is 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: The coordinates of points A and B are (2, 3) and (5, 7) respectively. What is the distance between A and B?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the distance formula d = √((x₂-x₁)² + (y₂-y₁)²). d = √((5-2)² + (7-3)²) = √((3)² + (4)²) = √(9 + 16) = √25 = 5.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Evaluate the integral ∫(2x + 1) dx.
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the power rule for integration, ∫xⁿ dx = xⁿ⁺¹/(n+1) + C. So, ∫2x dx = 2(x²/2) = x², and ∫1 dx = x. Therefore, the integral is x² + x + C.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If the radius of a sphere is doubled, what happens to its volume?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The volume of a sphere is V = (4/3)πr³. If the radius becomes 2r, the new volume V' = (4/3)π(2r)³ = (4/3)π(8r³) = 8 * (4/3)πr³ = 8V. So, the volume becomes 8 times its original.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the probability of rolling an even number on a standard six-sided die?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A standard six-sided die has faces {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}. The even numbers are {2, 4, 6}. There are 3 even numbers out of 6 total possibilities. So, probability = 3/6 = 1/2.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Solve the inequality: 2x - 3 > 7
questions.explanation_or_solution: Add 3 to both sides: 2x > 7 + 3 => 2x > 10. Divide by 2: x > 10 / 2 => x > 5.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the reciprocal of 0.25?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The reciprocal of a number 'a' is 1/a. 0.25 can be written as 1/4. So, the reciprocal of 1/4 is 1 / (1/4) = 4.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If the sum of two numbers is 10 and their difference is 4, what are the numbers?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Let the numbers be x and y. x + y = 10 and x - y = 4. Adding the two equations: (x + y) + (x - y) = 10 + 4 => 2x = 14 => x = 7. Substitute x=7 into the first equation: 7 + y = 10 => y = 3. So the numbers are (7, 3).

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the equation of a line with a slope of 2 and a y-intercept of 3?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The slope-intercept form of a linear equation is y = mx + b, where m is the slope and b is the y-intercept. Given m=2 and b=3, the equation is y = 2x + 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Convert 75% to a decimal.
questions.explanation_or_solution: To convert a percentage to a decimal, divide by 100. So, 75% = 75/100 = 0.75.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If 2ˣ = 8, what is the value of x?
questions.explanation_or_solution: We know that 8 can be written as 2³. So, 2ˣ = 2³ implies x = 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the area of a square with a side length of 6 cm?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The area of a square is given by side². So, Area = 6 cm * 6 cm = 36 cm².

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the value of cos(0°)?
questions.explanation_or_solution: On the unit circle, the x-coordinate at an angle of 0° is 1. Since cos(θ) is the x-coordinate, cos(0°) = 1.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: How many distinct permutations can be made from the letters of the word 'APPLE'?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The word APPLE has 5 letters. The letter 'P' appears twice. The formula for permutations with repetitions is n! / (n₁! * n₂! * ...). So, 5! / 2! = (5*4*3*2*1) / (2*1) = 120 / 2 = 60.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the median of the following set of numbers: 5, 2, 9, 3, 7?
questions.explanation_or_solution: First, arrange the numbers in ascending order: 2, 3, 5, 7, 9. The median is the middle value in an ordered set. In this case, it is 5.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If f(x) = x² + 1, what is f(3)?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Substitute x=3 into the function: f(3) = (3)² + 1 = 9 + 1 = 10.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: A rectangle has a length of 8 cm and a width of 5 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The perimeter of a rectangle is given by P = 2(length + width). P = 2(8 cm + 5 cm) = 2(13 cm) = 26 cm.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the prime factorization of 30?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Prime factorization involves breaking down a number into its prime factors. 30 = 2 * 15 = 2 * 3 * 5. All factors (2, 3, 5) are prime numbers.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Find the next term in the arithmetic sequence: 10, 7, 4, 1, ...
questions.explanation_or_solution: The common difference is d = 7 - 10 = -3. So, the next term is 1 - 3 = -2.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If (x+2)(x-3) = 0, what are the possible values of x?
questions.explanation_or_solution: For the product of two terms to be zero, at least one of the terms must be zero. So, x+2 = 0 => x = -2, or x-3 = 0 => x = 3. The values are -2 and 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the range of the function f(x) = x²?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Since x² always produces a non-negative result (0 or any positive number), the range of f(x) = x² is all non-negative real numbers [0, ∞).

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the result of 1/2 + 1/3?
questions.explanation_or_solution: To add fractions, find a common denominator, which is 6. (1/2)*(3/3) + (1/3)*(2/2) = 3/6 + 2/6 = 5/6.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: An angle measures 45°. What is its measure in radians?
questions.explanation_or_solution: To convert degrees to radians, multiply by π/180°. So, 45° * (π/180°) = π/4 radians.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If a = 5, what is the value of √(a² + 11)?

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the volume of a cylinder with radius 3 cm and height 10 cm? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
questions.explanation_or_solution: The volume of a cylinder is V = πr²h. V = 3.14 * (3 cm)² * 10 cm = 3.14 * 9 cm² * 10 cm = 3.14 * 90 cm³ = 282.6 cm³.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Which of these is a rational number?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A rational number can be expressed as a fraction p/q where p and q are integers and q ≠ 0. 0.333... is equal to 1/3, which is a rational number. √2, π, and e are irrational numbers.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: What comes next in the sequence: 2, 4, 8, 16, ?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The sequence is a geometric progression where each term is multiplied by 2 to get the next term. So, 16 * 2 = 32.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: A can do a piece of work in 10 days and B can do it in 15 days. In how many days can they complete the work together?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A's one day work = 1/10. B's one day work = 1/15. Together, their one day work = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6. So, they can complete the work together in 6 days.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: If 'CAT' is coded as '3120', how is 'DOG' coded?
questions.explanation_or_solution: CAT
Each letter is represented by its position in the English alphabet (A=1, B=2, C=3,...). So, C=3, A=1, T=20, giving 'CAT' as '3120'. For 'DOG': D=4, O=15, G=7. Concatenating these gives '4157'.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: If 6 men can complete a task in 8 days, how many days will 4 men take to complete the same task?
questions.explanation_or_solution: This is an inverse proportion problem. (Men₁ * Days₁) = (Men₂ * Days₂). So, 6 men * 8 days = 4 men * Days₂. 48 = 4 * Days₂. Days₂ = 48 / 4 = 12 days.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: Find the missing number: 1, 9, 25, 49, ?, 121
questions.explanation_or_solution: The sequence consists of the squares of consecutive odd numbers: 1²=1, 3²=9, 5²=25, 7²=49. The next odd number is 9, so the missing term is 9²=81. The following term is 11²=121, confirming the pattern.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: A clock shows 3:00. If the hour hand points East, in what direction will the minute hand point?
questions.explanation_or_solution: At 3:00, the hour hand points directly at 3. If 3 points East, then 12 (where the minute hand points) is 90 degrees counter-clockwise from East. This corresponds to North.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: What is 15% of 200?

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: If all 'P' are 'Q' and all 'Q' are 'R', then which of the following statements is definitely true?
questions.explanation_or_solution: This is a basic syllogism. If the set of P is entirely contained within Q, and the set of Q is entirely contained within R, then the set of P must also be entirely contained within R. Therefore, 'All P are R' is definitely true.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: A man walks 5 km East and then 12 km North. What is his shortest distance from the starting point?
questions.explanation_or_solution: This forms a right-angled triangle where the distances walked are the two perpendicular sides. The shortest distance from the starting point is the hypotenuse. Using the Pythagorean theorem: distance = √(5² + 12²) = √(25 + 144) = √169 = 13 km.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: Which number is the odd one out: 12, 18, 25, 30, 36?
questions.explanation_or_solution: All numbers except 25 are multiples of 6 (12=6*2, 18=6*3, 30=6*5, 36=6*6). 25 is a multiple of 5, and also a perfect square (5²).

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Choose the sentence with the correct subject-verb agreement.
options: The team is debating the issue.
The team are debating the issue.
The team have debating the issue.
questions.explanation_or_solution: When referring to a collective noun acting as a single unit, a singular verb is used. 'The team' acts as a single unit debating, hence 'is debating' is correct.

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Select the antonym of 'Benevolent'.
questions.explanation_or_solution: 'Benevolent' means well-meaning and kindly. 'Malicious' means characterized by malice; intending or intended to do harm, making it the direct antonym.

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: She is ______ honest woman.
questions.explanation_or_solution: The word 'honest' starts with a consonant but has a vowel sound ('o'). Therefore, 'an' is used before 'honest'.

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Which of the following sentences uses a metaphor?
options: The car was as fast as a cheetah.
The wind whispered secrets through the trees.
Her voice was music to his ears.
questions.explanation_or_solution: A metaphor directly compares two unlike things without using 'like' or 'as'. 'Her voice was music to his ears' directly equates her voice to music. The other options are similes or personification.

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Choose the correct spelling:
questions.explanation_or_solution: The correct spelling is 'Accommodate', with double 'c' and double 'm'.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A car accelerates uniformly from rest to 20 m/s in 5 seconds. What is the distance covered by the car during this time?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the equation v = u + at, we find acceleration a = (20-0)/5 = 4 m/s². Then, using s = ut + (1/2)at², s = 0*5 + (1/2)*4*(5)² = 2*25 = 50 m.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A block of mass 5 kg is resting on a horizontal surface. A force of 20 N is applied horizontally. If the coefficient of kinetic friction is 0.2, what is the acceleration of the block? (Take g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Friction force f_k = μ_k * N = μ_k * mg = 0.2 * 5 kg * 10 m/s² = 10 N. Net force = Applied force - Friction force = 20 N - 10 N = 10 N. Acceleration a = Net force / mass = 10 N / 5 kg = 2 m/s².
questions.svg_visual: <svg width="200" height="100"><rect x="50" y="50" width="100" height="30" style="fill:lightblue;stroke:black;stroke-width:2"/><line x1="20" y1="65" x2="50" y2="65" style="stroke:red;stroke-width:2;marker-end:url(#arrowhead)"/><text x="25" y="60" fill="red">20 N</text><text x="80" y="70" fill="black">5 kg</text><defs><marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="7" refX="0" refY="3.5" orient="auto"><polygon points="0 0, 10 3.5, 0 7" fill="red"/></marker></defs></svg>

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A 10 kg object is lifted vertically by a constant force of 120 N for a distance of 3 meters. What is the net work done on the object? (Take g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Work done by applied force = F_applied * d = 120 N * 3 m = 360 J. Work done by gravity = -mgd = -10 kg * 10 m/s² * 3 m = -300 J. Net work done = 360 J - 300 J = 60 J. Alternatively, net force = 120 N - (10 kg * 10 m/s²) = 20 N. Net work done = 20 N * 3 m = 60 J.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A sound wave travels at 340 m/s. If its frequency is 200 Hz, what is its wavelength?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the wave equation v = fλ, where v is speed, f is frequency, and λ is wavelength. So, λ = v/f = 340 m/s / 200 Hz = 1.7 m.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a scalar quantity?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Scalar quantities have magnitude only, while vector quantities have both magnitude and direction. Velocity, acceleration, and force are vectors, whereas mass is a scalar.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A converging lens has a focal length of 10 cm. An object is placed 15 cm from the lens. What is the image distance?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the lens formula 1/f = 1/v + 1/u. Given f = 10 cm (converging lens), u = -15 cm (object distance is negative by convention). So, 1/10 = 1/v + 1/(-15) => 1/v = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6. Therefore, v = 6 cm. Wait, 1/v = 1/10 - 1/(-15) = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6.  Oh, 1/v = 1/f - 1/u.  1/v = 1/10 - 1/(-15) = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6. The image distance is 30 cm. (Positive v indicates a real image on the opposite side of the lens).

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the phenomenon responsible for the sparkling of diamonds?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Diamonds sparkle due to their high refractive index and critical angle, which causes light to undergo multiple total internal reflections before exiting, scattering light in various directions.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If a current of 2 A flows through a resistor of 10 Ω, what is the voltage drop across the resistor?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using Ohm's Law, V = IR, where V is voltage, I is current, and R is resistance. So, V = 2 A * 10 Ω = 20 V.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which principle states that the buoyant force on a submerged object is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the object?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Archimedes' Principle explains buoyancy, stating that the upward buoyant force exerted on a body immersed in a fluid is equal to the weight of the fluid that the body displaces.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two point charges, +q and -q, are placed at a distance 'r' from each other. What is the magnitude of the electrostatic force between them?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Coulomb's Law states that the electrostatic force between two point charges is directly proportional to the product of the magnitudes of the charges and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them. F = k|q1q2|/r² = kq²/r².

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What type of mirror is used by dentists to see a magnified image of teeth?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A concave mirror produces a magnified, erect, and virtual image when an object is placed between its pole and focal point, making it suitable for dentists.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The half-life of a radioactive isotope is 2 hours. If you start with 100 grams, how much will remain after 6 hours?
questions.explanation_or_solution: After 2 hours (1 half-life), 50 g remains. After 4 hours (2 half-lives), 25 g remains. After 6 hours (3 half-lives), 12.5 g remains. (100 * (1/2)³) = 100 * (1/8) = 12.5 g.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which of the following describes the relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature of an ideal gas?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The Ideal Gas Law (PV=nRT) relates the pressure, volume, temperature, and number of moles of an ideal gas.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A pendulum completes 10 oscillations in 20 seconds. What is its frequency?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Frequency is the number of oscillations per unit time. So, frequency f = 10 oscillations / 20 seconds = 0.5 Hz.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The phenomenon of electromagnetic induction is used in which of the following devices?
questions.explanation_or_solution: An electric generator works on the principle of electromagnetic induction, where a changing magnetic flux through a coil induces an electromotive force (voltage).

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What happens to the kinetic energy of a falling object when air resistance is negligible?
questions.explanation_or_solution: As an object falls, its speed increases due to gravity. Since kinetic energy is proportional to the square of speed (KE = 1/2 mv²), its kinetic energy increases.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If the wavelength of light is 600 nm, what is its frequency? (Speed of light c = 3 x 10⁸ m/s)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using c = fλ, where c is the speed of light, f is frequency, and λ is wavelength. Convert wavelength to meters: 600 nm = 600 x 10⁻⁹ m = 6 x 10⁻⁷ m. So, f = c/λ = (3 x 10⁸ m/s) / (6 x 10⁻⁷ m) = 0.5 x 10¹⁵ Hz = 5 x 10¹⁴ Hz.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which of Newton's laws of motion describes inertia?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Newton's First Law of Motion, also known as the Law of Inertia, states that an object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The minimum energy required to eject an electron from the surface of a metal is called the:
questions.explanation_or_solution: The work function (Φ) is the minimum energy (usually measured in electronvolts) needed to remove an electron from the surface of a solid.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the unit of electric power?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The unit of electric power is the Watt (W), defined as one joule per second. Volt is the unit of voltage, Ampere for current, and Ohm for resistance.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A mass-spring system oscillates with a period T. If the mass is doubled, what happens to the period? (Assume ideal conditions)
questions.explanation_or_solution: The period of a mass-spring system is given by T = 2π√(m/k). If mass 'm' is doubled to '2m', the new period T' = 2π√(2m/k) = √2 * (2π√(m/k)) = √2 * T. So, the period increases by a factor of √2.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which type of electromagnetic wave has the longest wavelength?
questions.explanation_or_solution: In the electromagnetic spectrum, radio waves have the longest wavelengths and lowest frequencies, while gamma rays have the shortest wavelengths and highest frequencies.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the force required to accelerate a 500 kg car at 2 m/s²?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using Newton's Second Law, F = ma, where F is force, m is mass, and a is acceleration. So, F = 500 kg * 2 m/s² = 1000 N.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: According to the Law of Conservation of Energy, energy can be:
options: Transformed but not created or destroyed
questions.explanation_or_solution: The Law of Conservation of Energy states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, but it can be transformed from one form to another.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the name of the effect where light bends as it passes from one medium to another?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Refraction is the bending of light (or other waves) as it passes from one transparent medium into another, due to a change in its speed.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: How many grams of CO₂ are produced when 24 g of carbon is completely burned in oxygen? (Atomic mass: C=12, O=16)
questions.explanation_or_solution: The reaction is C + O₂ → CO₂. Molar mass of C = 12 g/mol, Molar mass of CO₂ = 12 + 2*16 = 44 g/mol. From the balanced equation, 1 mole of C (12 g) produces 1 mole of CO₂ (44 g). So, 24 g of C (2 moles) will produce 2 * 44 g = 88 g of CO₂.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is the strongest acid among the hydrohalic acids?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Acidity increases down the group for hydrohalic acids because the bond strength decreases with increasing atomic size of the halogen, making it easier to release H⁺ ions. Therefore, HI is the strongest acid among the given options.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the pH of a neutral solution at 25°C?
questions.explanation_or_solution: At 25°C, the concentration of H⁺ ions and OH⁻ ions in pure water are both 1 x 10⁻⁷ M, making the pH = -log[H⁺] = -log(1 x 10⁻⁷) = 7, which is neutral.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which type of bonding involves the sharing of electrons between atoms?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Covalent bonding is characterized by the sharing of one or more pairs of electrons between atoms to achieve a stable electron configuration.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the oxidation state of sulfur in H₂SO₄?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Hydrogen (H) has an oxidation state of +1, and Oxygen (O) has -2. For H₂SO₄: 2*(+1) + S + 4*(-2) = 0 => 2 + S - 8 = 0 => S - 6 = 0 => S = +6.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which element is a noble gas?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Noble gases are elements in Group 18 of the periodic table, including Helium, Neon, Argon, Krypton, Xenon, and Radon, known for their low reactivity.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the general formula for an alkane?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Alkanes are saturated hydrocarbons with only single bonds between carbon atoms. Their general formula is CnH2n+2, where n is the number of carbon atoms.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of an endothermic reaction?
questions.explanation_or_solution: An endothermic reaction absorbs heat from its surroundings. Melting of ice requires heat energy to break intermolecular bonds, thus it is an endothermic process.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the main component of natural gas?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Natural gas is primarily composed of methane (CH₄), typically 70-90%, along with smaller amounts of other hydrocarbons and non-hydrocarbon gases.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which phenomenon causes the scattering of light by colloidal particles?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The Tyndall effect is the scattering of light by particles in a colloid or in a very fine suspension. It is often used to distinguish colloids from true solutions.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: According to VSEPR theory, what is the shape of a methane (CH₄) molecule?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Methane has a central carbon atom bonded to four hydrogen atoms, with no lone pairs on the central atom. This results in a tetrahedral electron geometry and molecular geometry.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the common name for sodium bicarbonate?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO₃) is commonly known as baking soda. It is used as a leavening agent in baking.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of these is a d-block element?
questions.explanation_or_solution: d-block elements are also known as transition metals. Iron (Fe) is located in the d-block of the periodic table, specifically in Group 8, Period 4.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the maximum number of electrons that can occupy the third energy level (n=3)?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The maximum number of electrons in an energy level 'n' is given by the formula 2n². For n=3, the maximum number of electrons is 2*(3)² = 2*9 = 18.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is a strong base?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Strong bases fully dissociate in water to produce hydroxide ions (OH⁻). Sodium hydroxide (NaOH) is a classic example of a strong base. NH₃ (ammonia) is a weak base, CH₃COOH (acetic acid) is a weak acid, and H₂CO₃ (carbonic acid) is a weak acid.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The process of converting a liquid into a gas below its boiling point is called:
questions.explanation_or_solution: Evaporation is the process by which atoms or molecules in a liquid state gain sufficient energy to spontaneously transition into the gaseous state below its boiling point.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is the mass of 0.5 moles of water (H₂O)? (Atomic mass: H=1, O=16)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Molar mass of H₂O = (2*1) + 16 = 18 g/mol. Mass = moles * molar mass = 0.5 mol * 18 g/mol = 9 g.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which type of reaction involves the transfer of electrons?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A redox (reduction-oxidation) reaction is a type of chemical reaction that involves a transfer of electrons between two species, leading to changes in their oxidation states.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The phenomenon by which an element can exist in two or more different forms with different physical properties but identical chemical properties is called:
questions.explanation_or_solution: Allotropy is the property of some chemical elements to exist in two or more different forms, in the same physical state, known as allotropes. Examples include carbon (diamond, graphite).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a homogeneous mixture?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A homogeneous mixture has a uniform composition and appearance throughout. Saltwater (a solution) is an example, as the salt is completely dissolved and evenly distributed in the water.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If x² - 5x + 6 = 0, what are the values of x?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The quadratic equation x² - 5x + 6 = 0 can be factored as (x - 2)(x - 3) = 0. Therefore, the values of x are 2 and 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: In a right-angled triangle, if the two shorter sides are 3 cm and 4 cm, what is the length of the hypotenuse?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the Pythagorean theorem, a² + b² = c². So, 3² + 4² = c² => 9 + 16 = c² => 25 = c² => c = 5 cm.
questions.svg_visual: <svg width="200" height="150"><polygon points="10,140 10,60 70,140" style="fill:none;stroke:black;stroke-width:2"/><text x="5" y="100" font-size="14">3 cm</text><text x="30" y="145" font-size="14">4 cm</text><text x="40" y="90" font-size="14">?</text><rect x="10" y="130" width="10" height="10" style="fill:none;stroke:black;stroke-width:1"/></svg>

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the derivative of f(x) = 3x² + 2x - 1?
questions.explanation_or_solution: To find the derivative, apply the power rule: d/dx(axⁿ) = naxⁿ⁻¹. So, d/dx(3x²) = 6x, d/dx(2x) = 2, and d/dx(-1) = 0. Thus, the derivative is 6x + 2.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Simplify the expression: 2(x + 3) - (x - 1)
questions.explanation_or_solution: Expand the terms: 2x + 6 - x + 1. Combine like terms: (2x - x) + (6 + 1) = x + 7.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If a = 3 and b = -2, what is the value of a² - b³?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Substitute the values: a² = 3² = 9. b³ = (-2)³ = -8. So, a² - b³ = 9 - (-8) = 9 + 8 = 17.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the area of a circle with a radius of 7 cm? (Use π ≈ 22/7)
questions.explanation_or_solution: The area of a circle is given by A = πr². A = (22/7) * (7 cm)² = (22/7) * 49 cm² = 22 * 7 cm² = 154 cm².

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Solve for x: 3x + 7 = 19
questions.explanation_or_solution: Subtract 7 from both sides: 3x = 19 - 7 => 3x = 12. Divide by 3: x = 12 / 3 => x = 4.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the sum of the interior angles of a quadrilateral?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The sum of the interior angles of a polygon with n sides is given by (n-2) * 180°. For a quadrilateral, n=4, so (4-2) * 180° = 2 * 180° = 360°.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Find the value of sin(30°) + cos(60°).

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If a set A = {1, 2, 3, 4} and a set B = {3, 4, 5, 6}, what is A ∪ B?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A ∪ B (union of A and B) includes all elements that are in A, or in B, or in both. So, A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the value of 5! (5 factorial)?

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: The price of an item was increased by 20% and then decreased by 20%. What is the net percentage change in the price?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Let the original price be P. Increased by 20%: P * 1.20 = 1.2P. Decreased by 20%: 1.2P * 0.80 = 0.96P. The net change is P - 0.96P = 0.04P. So, a 4% decrease.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If y = x³, what is dy/dx?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the power rule for differentiation, d/dx(xⁿ) = nxⁿ⁻¹. So, d/dx(x³) = 3x².

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the common difference of the arithmetic progression: 5, 8, 11, 14, ...?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The common difference (d) is found by subtracting any term from its succeeding term. d = 8 - 5 = 3; d = 11 - 8 = 3. So, the common difference is 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the value of log₁₀(1000)?
questions.explanation_or_solution: log₁₀(1000) asks: 10 to what power equals 1000? Since 10³ = 1000, the value is 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: The coordinates of points A and B are (2, 3) and (5, 7) respectively. What is the distance between A and B?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the distance formula d = √((x₂-x₁)² + (y₂-y₁)²). d = √((5-2)² + (7-3)²) = √((3)² + (4)²) = √(9 + 16) = √25 = 5.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Evaluate the integral ∫(2x + 1) dx.
questions.explanation_or_solution: Using the power rule for integration, ∫xⁿ dx = xⁿ⁺¹/(n+1) + C. So, ∫2x dx = 2(x²/2) = x², and ∫1 dx = x. Therefore, the integral is x² + x + C.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If the radius of a sphere is doubled, what happens to its volume?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The volume of a sphere is V = (4/3)πr³. If the radius becomes 2r, the new volume V' = (4/3)π(2r)³ = (4/3)π(8r³) = 8 * (4/3)πr³ = 8V. So, the volume becomes 8 times its original.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the probability of rolling an even number on a standard six-sided die?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A standard six-sided die has faces {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}. The even numbers are {2, 4, 6}. There are 3 even numbers out of 6 total possibilities. So, probability = 3/6 = 1/2.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Solve the inequality: 2x - 3 > 7
questions.explanation_or_solution: Add 3 to both sides: 2x > 7 + 3 => 2x > 10. Divide by 2: x > 10 / 2 => x > 5.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the reciprocal of 0.25?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The reciprocal of a number 'a' is 1/a. 0.25 can be written as 1/4. So, the reciprocal of 1/4 is 1 / (1/4) = 4.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If the sum of two numbers is 10 and their difference is 4, what are the numbers?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Let the numbers be x and y. x + y = 10 and x - y = 4. Adding the two equations: (x + y) + (x - y) = 10 + 4 => 2x = 14 => x = 7. Substitute x=7 into the first equation: 7 + y = 10 => y = 3. So the numbers are (7, 3).

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the equation of a line with a slope of 2 and a y-intercept of 3?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The slope-intercept form of a linear equation is y = mx + b, where m is the slope and b is the y-intercept. Given m=2 and b=3, the equation is y = 2x + 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Convert 75% to a decimal.
questions.explanation_or_solution: To convert a percentage to a decimal, divide by 100. So, 75% = 75/100 = 0.75.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If 2ˣ = 8, what is the value of x?
questions.explanation_or_solution: We know that 8 can be written as 2³. So, 2ˣ = 2³ implies x = 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the area of a square with a side length of 6 cm?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The area of a square is given by side². So, Area = 6 cm * 6 cm = 36 cm².

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the value of cos(0°)?
questions.explanation_or_solution: On the unit circle, the x-coordinate at an angle of 0° is 1. Since cos(θ) is the x-coordinate, cos(0°) = 1.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: How many distinct permutations can be made from the letters of the word 'APPLE'?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The word APPLE has 5 letters. The letter 'P' appears twice. The formula for permutations with repetitions is n! / (n₁! * n₂! * ...). So, 5! / 2! = (5*4*3*2*1) / (2*1) = 120 / 2 = 60.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the median of the following set of numbers: 5, 2, 9, 3, 7?
questions.explanation_or_solution: First, arrange the numbers in ascending order: 2, 3, 5, 7, 9. The median is the middle value in an ordered set. In this case, it is 5.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If f(x) = x² + 1, what is f(3)?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Substitute x=3 into the function: f(3) = (3)² + 1 = 9 + 1 = 10.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: A rectangle has a length of 8 cm and a width of 5 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The perimeter of a rectangle is given by P = 2(length + width). P = 2(8 cm + 5 cm) = 2(13 cm) = 26 cm.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the prime factorization of 30?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Prime factorization involves breaking down a number into its prime factors. 30 = 2 * 15 = 2 * 3 * 5. All factors (2, 3, 5) are prime numbers.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Find the next term in the arithmetic sequence: 10, 7, 4, 1, ...
questions.explanation_or_solution: The common difference is d = 7 - 10 = -3. So, the next term is 1 - 3 = -2.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If (x+2)(x-3) = 0, what are the possible values of x?
questions.explanation_or_solution: For the product of two terms to be zero, at least one of the terms must be zero. So, x+2 = 0 => x = -2, or x-3 = 0 => x = 3. The values are -2 and 3.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the range of the function f(x) = x²?
questions.explanation_or_solution: Since x² always produces a non-negative result (0 or any positive number), the range of f(x) = x² is all non-negative real numbers [0, ∞).

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the result of 1/2 + 1/3?
questions.explanation_or_solution: To add fractions, find a common denominator, which is 6. (1/2)*(3/3) + (1/3)*(2/2) = 3/6 + 2/6 = 5/6.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: An angle measures 45°. What is its measure in radians?
questions.explanation_or_solution: To convert degrees to radians, multiply by π/180°. So, 45° * (π/180°) = π/4 radians.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: If a = 5, what is the value of √(a² + 11)?

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: What is the volume of a cylinder with radius 3 cm and height 10 cm? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
questions.explanation_or_solution: The volume of a cylinder is V = πr²h. V = 3.14 * (3 cm)² * 10 cm = 3.14 * 9 cm² * 10 cm = 3.14 * 90 cm³ = 282.6 cm³.

questions.subject: Maths
questions.question_text: Which of these is a rational number?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A rational number can be expressed as a fraction p/q where p and q are integers and q ≠ 0. 0.333... is equal to 1/3, which is a rational number. √2, π, and e are irrational numbers.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: What comes next in the sequence: 2, 4, 8, 16, ?
questions.explanation_or_solution: The sequence is a geometric progression where each term is multiplied by 2 to get the next term. So, 16 * 2 = 32.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: A can do a piece of work in 10 days and B can do it in 15 days. In how many days can they complete the work together?
questions.explanation_or_solution: A's one day work = 1/10. B's one day work = 1/15. Together, their one day work = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 5/30 = 1/6. So, they can complete the work together in 6 days.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: If 'CAT' is coded as '3120', how is 'DOG' coded?
questions.explanation_or_solution: CAT
Each letter is represented by its position in the English alphabet (A=1, B=2, C=3,...). So, C=3, A=1, T=20, giving 'CAT' as '3120'. For 'DOG': D=4, O=15, G=7. Concatenating these gives '4157'.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: If 6 men can complete a task in 8 days, how many days will 4 men take to complete the same task?
questions.explanation_or_solution: This is an inverse proportion problem. (Men₁ * Days₁) = (Men₂ * Days₂). So, 6 men * 8 days = 4 men * Days₂. 48 = 4 * Days₂. Days₂ = 48 / 4 = 12 days.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: Find the missing number: 1, 9, 25, 49, ?, 121
questions.explanation_or_solution: The sequence consists of the squares of consecutive odd numbers: 1²=1, 3²=9, 5²=25, 7²=49. The next odd number is 9, so the missing term is 9²=81. The following term is 11²=121, confirming the pattern.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: A clock shows 3:00. If the hour hand points East, in what direction will the minute hand point?
questions.explanation_or_solution: At 3:00, the hour hand points directly at 3. If 3 points East, then 12 (where the minute hand points) is 90 degrees counter-clockwise from East. This corresponds to North.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: What is 15% of 200?

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: If all 'P' are 'Q' and all 'Q' are 'R', then which of the following statements is definitely true?
questions.explanation_or_solution: This is a basic syllogism. If the set of P is entirely contained within Q, and the set of Q is entirely contained within R, then the set of P must also be entirely contained within R. Therefore, 'All P are R' is definitely true.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: A man walks 5 km East and then 12 km North. What is his shortest distance from the starting point?
questions.explanation_or_solution: This forms a right-angled triangle where the distances walked are the two perpendicular sides. The shortest distance from the starting point is the hypotenuse. Using the Pythagorean theorem: distance = √(5² + 12²) = √(25 + 144) = √169 = 13 km.

questions.subject: Aptitude
questions.question_text: Which number is the odd one out: 12, 18, 25, 30, 36?
questions.explanation_or_solution: All numbers except 25 are multiples of 6 (12=6*2, 18=6*3, 30=6*5, 36=6*6). 25 is a multiple of 5, and also a perfect square (5²).

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Choose the sentence with the correct subject-verb agreement.
options: The team is debating the issue.
The team are debating the issue.
The team have debating the issue.
questions.explanation_or_solution: When referring to a collective noun acting as a single unit, a singular verb is used. 'The team' acts as a single unit debating, hence 'is debating' is correct.

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Select the antonym of 'Benevolent'.
questions.explanation_or_solution: 'Benevolent' means well-meaning and kindly. 'Malicious' means characterized by malice; intending or intended to do harm, making it the direct antonym.

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: She is ______ honest woman.
questions.explanation_or_solution: The word 'honest' starts with a consonant but has a vowel sound ('o'). Therefore, 'an' is used before 'honest'.

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Which of the following sentences uses a metaphor?
options: The car was as fast as a cheetah.
The wind whispered secrets through the trees.
Her voice was music to his ears.
questions.explanation_or_solution: A metaphor directly compares two unlike things without using 'like' or 'as'. 'Her voice was music to his ears' directly equates her voice to music. The other options are similes or personification.

questions.subject: English
questions.question_text: Choose the correct spelling:
questions.explanation_or_solution: The correct spelling is 'Accommodate', with double 'c' and double 'm'.
